[[File:Viasatsport.png|right|200px]] [[File:Viasat Sport old logo.png|right|200px]] '''Viasat Sport''' is the common brand of several sports channels targeting the [[Nordic countries|Nordic]], [[Baltic countries|Baltic]] and [[Eastern Europe]]an countries owned by [[Modern Times Group]]. '''Viasat Sport''' is also the name of one tv-channel in [[Russia]], [[Belarus]], [[Ukraine]], [[Kazakhstan]] and the Baltics. Its main competitors are [[C More Entertainment|CANAL+ Sport]] and [[Eurosport]].

==Channels== ''Viasat Sport'' was launched as a pan-Nordic channel in 1999. In January 2002, a dedicated Danish channel, ''[[TV 2 Sport (Denmark)|Viasat Sport Denmark]]'', launched and replaced the pan-Nordic version in Denmark.
1 February 2004, Viasat launched two new sport channels; ''[[Viasat Sport 2]]'' and ''[[Viasat Sport 3]]''. The two existing channels were re-branded as ''[[Viasat Sport 1]]''. During the autumn the two new channels were refocused, turning Viasat Sport 2 into a dedicated soccer channel and Viasat Sport 3 becoming a channel for motor and contact sports.
In April 2005, a "news channel" called ''[[Viasat Sport 24]]'' was launched.
In the end of 2005, Viasat Sport 1 in Norway was replaced by ''[[SportN]]'', a joint venture with government-owned public broadcaster [[Norwegian Broadcasting Corporation|NRK]] .
In January 2007, a dedicated golf channel, ''[[Viasat Golf]]'', was launched replacing ''[[Viasat Sport 24]]''.<ref>{{cite news| title=MTG EXTENDS AND ACQUIRES GOLF RIGHTS AND LAUNCHES DEDICATED GOLF CHANNEL| url=http://www.cisionwire.com/mtg/mtg-extends-and-acquires-golf-rights-and-launches-dedicated-golf-channel| publisher=[[Cision Wire]]| date=2006-12-20| accessdate=2008-10-29}}</ref>
11 April 2007, Viasat Sport 1 in Denmark was replaced by ''[[TV 2 Sport (Denmark)|TV 2 Sport]]''<ref>{{dk icon}} {{cite news| title=TV 2 Sport gÃ¥r i luften onsdag| url=http://sporten.tv2.dk/article.php/id-6642790.html| publisher=TV2.dk| date=2007-04-11| accessdate=2008-10-29}}</ref>:, a joint venture with state-owned broadcaster [[TV 2 (Denmark)|TV 2]].
In early 2008, Viasat launched their first high-definition sports channels: ''[[TV 2 Sport HD]]'' for Denmark and ''[[Viasat Sport HD]]'' fÃ¶r Norway and Sweden.
On October 17, 2008, the Viasat Sport channels went through a major overhaul which saw ''Viasat Sport 2'' and ''3'' disappear in Sweden and Norway. They were replaced by ''[[Viasat Fotboll]]'' (in Sweden), ''[[Viasat Sport Norway|Viasat Sport]]'' (in Norge) and ''[[Viasat Motor]]'' (both countries). The Swedish ''Viasat Sport 1'' was renamed ''[[Viasat Sport Sweden|Viasat Sport]]''. ''Viasat Sport HD'' continued to be available in both Norway and Sweden, and ''Viasat Golf'' was still available in all four Scandinavian countries.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://php.mtg.se/observer/news.php?action=&action_id=5&news_id=173398|title=MTG: NEW SPORTS CHANNEL LINE-UP IN SWEDEN AND NORWAY|publisher=Modern Times Group|date=October 6, 2008}}</ref>
Viasat Sport 2 and 3 continued in Denmark, Finland and the Baltics until January 6, 2009. On January 7, 2009, ''Viasat Sport Baltic'' channel was launched in Baltic states. ''Viasat Golf'' also became available in the region. Finland and Denmark didn't receive any replacements for Viasat Sport 2 and 3. In Bulgaria the channel is called 'Nova Sport'.
